intro: Gifola lagopus, commonly known as the snowbean, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a herbaceous annual that grows in open, rocky, or sandy soils. The plant has small, white to pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in cold climates. Gifola lagopus is adapted to withstand harsh winter conditions and is an important part of the tundra ecosystem.
